description: A few bits of foliage, tied together into a rope. Used for crafting.
Generic alien plant life. Barely edible, with a dissatisfying taste. Might make you sick. Decays fast. Often used in crafting.
A thin, deceptively durable string made of prepared plant matter. Used in more intricate recipes.
Thin, flexible sheet made of plant matter. Light and decently durable for what it is.
Bits and pieces of smashed wood. You could probably make them into a crafting material.
A small pile of ripped clothing. Can be used as a makeshift bandage for bleeding wounds.
A roll of dressing with a bandage, used to slow down bleeding, stabilize fractures and aid skin healing. Counteracts infections. Has no effect on muscle health.
Advanced chemical compound that greatly promotes chemical reactions and is able to mend certain materials together, or even melt them. Very commonly used in crafting.
Mild opiate for pain relief. Lesser effect when taken orally.
Strong opiate for pain relief. Lesser effect when taken orally.
Highly potent opiate, 100 times stronger than morphine. Consider diluting it.
Opioid pills used to treat pain. Overdose at 60ml.
An advanced mix of drugs that alters the structure and function of your brain, slightly increasing your mobility permanently. You might not want to use it more than once.
Simple, small bottle for holding liquids, made with some glued together chunks of plastic tied together with rope. Holds 300mL.
A very flimsy bag made of tied together foliage.
A foliage bag with added reinforcements, made to be worn on your back.
Solid cube made of melted scrap metal. Not particularly strong, but will do in crafting.
Thin sheet of scrap metal. Not partiularly strong, but will do in crafting.
Hollow tube made of scrap metal. Not partiularly strong, but will do in crafting. Could act as a shoddy makeshift hammer.
A pile of crudely made nails. Should be enough to last a few recipes. You'll probably need a hammer to drive them.
Solid cube made of melted together wood. While it's very frail, it's also light.
Thin sheet made of wood. While it's very frail, it's also light.
A short wooden stick. While it's very frail, it's also light. Way too small to use as a weapon. Could act as a shoddy makeshift hammer.

A small, dull, brittle knife. Can be used for rudimentary crafting. Little to no use in combat.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.
Chunk of bio-chem processed copper. Malleable and conductive, you could turn it into wiring for electronics.
Bundle of neatly tied together wires with some isolation around them. Used in electronics crafting.
A rectangular slab made of a strong titanium alloy. Can be used for advanced crafting.
A thin, yet firm sheet made of a strong titanium alloy. Can be used for advanced crafting.
A solid rod made of a strong titanium alloy. Can be used for advanced crafting, and as a makeshift hammer.
Yellow blood from an alien. While it looks similar to yours, it visibly differs a bit. Shouldn't be too bad to use as replacement blood, though.
Mixture of salt and water, often used in treating hypovolemia and thirst.
Yellow blood. While the color seems normal to you, it's apparently a side effect of the bio-engineering process. Used in treating hypovolemia.
A crude tool that's probably better at hitting bolts into place than actually turning them. It won't help with dislocations, but is useful in crafting.'

A tool used to provide grip and mechanical advantage in applying torque to turn objects. Can be used on dislocated limbs to correct them more effectively than with your bare hands. Also makes for a decent hammering tool.

Cobbled together metal cleaver, with a blade nailed onto the handle. Would do well in crafting. You feel uneasy holding it.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

A big, broad metal blade. Would do well in melee combat. You feel uneasy holding it.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.
A chalky and highly flammable powder. Useful in making explosives.
Empty casing. While it's not of much use by itself, you could use it in crafting.
A small handgun round. Can be loaded into a small magazine, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.
A rifle round. Can be loaded into a rifle magazine, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.
A 12 gauge buckshot round. Can be loaded into shotguns, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.
A specially shaped container with a spring in it. Used in magazine and firearm making.
A universal handgun magazine that accepts 9mm rounds.
A universal rifle magazine that accepts 5.56 rounds.
A box that can store sixteen 12-Gauge rounds. Use to unload a shell to insert into a firearm.
An explosive made of nitroglycerin, sorbents, and stabilizers. Good for making holes in the terrain. Not very good for your ears.
Two insect carcasses joined together, forming a half-tube shape. Used in crafting.
A bit of circuitry, ripped out of a once working machine. It still sparks occasionally. Used in crafting.
A small battery that can be inserted into various electronic devices. Stores half as much as a medium battery.
A generic battery that can be inserted into various electronic devices. Stores twice as much as a small battery, but a third as much as a large one.
A large industrial battery that can be inserted into certain electornic devices. Stores three times as much as a medium battery.
Lights up a large area in front of it, but slowly loses battery. Use to change mode.
A little flashlight, made to be strapped onto your forehead. Loses battery over time.
A simple electronic display, used in crafting.
A thin sheet of flexible, transparent material, made from chemically treated plastic. Used in crafting.
An electric light with a filament that is heated until it glows. Seems to be battery powered. Don't put it in your mouth.
Makeshift wraps made from gauze to cover the extremities. Slightly protects your arms and feet from damage and makes you feel like a warrior.
It's just a glowplant fruit strapped to your forehead. Not exactly comfortable, but frees up some inventory space.
A helmet designed to reduce the severity of impacts to the head. Reduces head injuries from falls.
A rudimentary helmet made out of some rope and stitched together carcasses. Provides some head protection.
A piece of thrown together and tied up metal, made for digging through rock. It's a bit flimsy.

An improvised bolt-action firearm, made of scrapped together tubes and gun scraps. Uses small magazines loaded with 9mm rounds. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.
A small, consumer-grade laser drill. Not the best at digging, but uses no stamina.
A roll of dressing with a bandage, used to slow down bleeding, stabilize fractures and aid skin healing. Has no effect on muscle health.
A simple, wood and glass lantern with a bright yellow crystal inside of it.
Shows you a low-quality map of the terrain below you. Terrain is highlighted in green, solid buildings in red. Goes 24 meters down.
Lets you indefinitely breathe and regenerate stamina underwater, makes you move faster in liquids and dries you out quickly after resurfacing. The pool floaties are retrofitted.
A tool specially crafted to dig rock. Very efficient at removing terrain, though slow.
A hyper-compressed box of scaffolding, made to be easily placed down. Lasts 100 uses.
A medium sized backpack.
A decently sized bag made of fabric.
A large, sturdy pouch that attaches to your thigh, with many small pockets to hold crafting materials. Has a high encumbrance reduction, but only accepts very small items.
A leather belt to go over your belly. You could attach something to it.
A foliage bowl that can hold 0.5L of liquid. Somehow, you're unable to create it without the cereal.
Liquid animal fat, gotten from flesh. Can be eaten, though not particularly pleasant. Can be processed into soap.
Soap made from animal fat. Can be used in the health panel to clean dirt off of you, and slightly disinfect wounds.
A small vial of a clot-promoting poultice. Needs to be held in a special container in order to not go bad. While not particularly useful on its own, it could be refined further...
Pills used to treat general ailments like sickness or opiate abuse. Lowers happiness and may cause vomiting.
Potent antidepressant pills. Makes you feel everything less for some time, and slowly increases happiness. Might have side effects.
A medical marvel when it was invented, this little device is able to automatically find a vein or artery to inject to and deliver the provided dosage. Used in medicinal crafting.
Attaches to your thigh and automatically activates when you go into a critical state, keeping your oxygen at livable levels and providing energy, but only once.
Smushed together bits of fruit and foliage, resulting in a mixture effective in treating infections. Lasts one use.
A roll of specially synthesized tough material, made to efficiently cover wounds and stabilize fractures. Has no effect on muscle health.

When applied, it cuts off circulation to the limb, stopping all bleeding in the affected area (though it does not heal the wound). It must be removed after some time, as it causes pain and deprives the limb of oxygen. Reusable.
A very experimental bit of technology that welds a fracture back together, vastly speeding up healing. Causes some damage to the limb due to the process - better have some dressing ready.
A simple pair of metal tweezers. Can cleanly and painlessly remove shrapnel from limbs.
A 0.75L plastic bag with an autoinjector at the end. Injects 375mL on use. Use in the inventory to draw blood from yourself.
A 0.75L bag with a needle at the end, for injecting fluids intravenously.
Basic antiseptic fluid. Counteracts infections and stings a little.
Mix of chemicals and drugs that instantly relieves pain and disinfects wounds.
A sturdy board, made to aid fractures. Helps with healing fractures and dislocations. Putting it on a functional limb will still immobilize it, reducing your capabilities.
A combination of drugs and other medicines, made to aid muscle healing. Increases muscle/skin health and highly aids dislocations. Doesn't affect bleeding.
A hard, long tube made from multiple joined carcasses. Functions as a decent makeshift splint for treating fractures.

A makeshift Localized Resuscitation Device. Looks like it's taped together. Increases the muscle health and disinfects limb it's used on, AND any directly adjacent limbs. Slightly reduces internal bleeding if used on the chest. Requires atleast 25mL of LRD serum to function.

A Localized Resuscitation Device, made to easily provide effective general trauma care. Increases limb health, slows bleeding, provides pain relieving drugs and disinfects the limb it's used on, along with any adjacent limbs. Highly reduces internal bleeding if used on the chest. Requires atleast 25mL of LRD serum to function.
Special mixture used by a Localized Resuscitation Device. Does nothing if injected via other tools.
A bunch of fruit, vegetables and whatever else you could find, mashed up and mixed with water. It tastes... interesting.
Cooked through, better mixed and mashed produce juice. Very tasty and nutricious!
A small bundle of spare parts, made to repair Drill Pods. You could use one of these to get a pod back into a working state.
Chemical which promotes blood clotting. Globally slows down blood loss, including internal bleeding.
A 0.2L plastic bottle with a spray nozzle on it. Can spray 10ml of liquid at a time.

A device to start a fire by friction between a rapidly rotating wooden rod and a cavity on a stationary wood piece. In layman's terms, stick rotatey, fire starty. Can be used up to 3 times before burning out.
A lit campfire. Warm and cozy, you'll heat up when next to it. Used as a heat source in a variety of food recipes.
Slightly dirty groundwater. Mostly safe to drink, though slightly sickening.
Small, light piece of charcoal. Can be used as a flammable ingredient for crafting.
A loaf of bread, made of flour and water. About the simplest thing you could eat, though not repulsive and will last for a long time.
A powder mainly used in making baked goods. You'll probably need some water and a heat source to work with it.
Extremely primitive lightsource. While it lights up the way pretty well, it will be put out by liquids. You can relight it with a bit of fat and a flame source.
Extremely primitive lightsource. While it lights up the way pretty well, it will be put out by liquids. You can relight it with a bit of fat and a flame source.
Solid, edible bar of pure nutrients and calories. Neutral taste, and doesn't spoil.
A mixture of fat, dried meat, and dehydrated fruit. Lasts a long time and is very calorie-dense. Tastes neutral.
A decent prepared food, made of crispy foliage and rudimentary filling. Won't last for long and has no fat, but it's very filling.
A big, tasty snack. Fills both your tummy and soul!
Unidentifiable soup, though still tasty and filling.
A cold bag filled with self-cooling refrigerant gel. Speeds up muscle healing, reduces pain and cools you down slightly. Automatically cools itself over time.
Red, warm, and fuzzy, this long scarf provides some insulation from the elements. Makes you feel like a mercenary...
A finely crafted tool, made out of forged titanium. Very durable and efficient at removing terrain, though not very combat capable.

A very capable and durable tool for combat, both easy and light to swing, yet razor-sharp and devastating. Its edge is heat treated to keep its sharpness for a long time. An amazing tool for self defense, and can be used as a digging tool as a last resort.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

A small, yet very firm and durable tool used for crafting, with a heavy hammer top and a tiny yet razor sharp blade hidden in the handle. While not useful for digging nor combat, it will last neigh indefinitely for all sorts of crafting recipes, and is light.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.
A long, strengthened sheet of rope with attachment points at each end. You could place it over a large drop and use it to climb down. Has two uses.
